hero.subtitle: Building Maintenance Management Software
hero.builtBy: Built by a Level 3 IRATA Tech & Operations Manager
hero.descriptionEnd: , from a single platform that actually speaks rope access.

painPoints.title: Your competitors think they're organized.
painPoints.subtitle: But in reality:
painPoints.payrollErrors: They're losing $40K/year to payroll errors they don't see.
painPoints.adminTime: They're spending 80 hours monthly on admin that should take 10.
painPoints.underbidding: They're underbidding 25% of jobs because they're guessing.
painPoints.complaints: They're juggling resident complaints between memory, emails, texts, phone calls, notes in a glovebox.
painPoints.lawsuit: They're one accident away from a lawsuit they can't defend because their safety documentation is (maybe) under the driver's front seat.
painPoints.losingContracts: They're losing contracts because they look like amateurs next to you.
painPoints.conclusion: Let them keep thinking they're organized.

roiCalculator.title: Calculate Your Hidden Costs In Less Than 60 Seconds
roiCalculator.subtitle: Most rope access companies waste $15,000-25,000 per year on scattered online SAAS tools, manual processes, hidden admin costs, and wasted time. Find out how much you could save.

cta.title: Ready to Streamline Your Rope Access Operations?
cta.subtitle: Join rope access companies who've already ditched the spreadsheet chaos

features.title: Juggling 10 Different Tools Is Costing You More Than Time
features.subtitle: Replace scattered systems with one platform built specifically for rope access companies managing techs across multiple buildings. Time tracking, safety compliance, project visibility, payroll precision, resident communication - all within one intelligent platform.

projects.title: 4-Elevation Building Visualization
projects.description: Track all four sides (N/E/S/W) of every project with visual progress bars. Know instantly: "West elevation 68% done. North finished. East behind schedule." Finally, stop guessing. Your crew knows. Your client knows. You know.

workSessions.title: 4 Hours or 30 Minutes?
workSessions.tagline: That's How Long Payroll Takes. Your Choice.
workSessions.description: Clock in. Clock out. System calculates hours down to the second. 8h 15m worked on Tower One. 6h 42m on Tower Five. Zero disputes. Zero spreadsheets. Zero "I swear I worked 9 hours." 87-93% time savings. Your competitor? Still using Excel.

nonBillable.title: $12,600 Fell Through The Cracks
nonBillable.tagline: Travel Time. Setup Time. You Paid. Client Didn't.
nonBillable.description: Paid for 45 hours. Billed for 32 hours. That's 13 hours donated. Every. Single. Week. Track travel time, equipment setup, weather delays separately. See your billable ratio: 68%. Target: 75%+. Stop the bleed. Your margins thank you.

employees.title: Team Management & Permissions
employees.tagline: Supervisors Log Drops. They Don't See Pay Rates.
employees.description: Financial data stays private. IRATA levels tracked. 100% payroll accuracy. Hourly rates configured. Zero awkward conversations. Give supervisors job tools, not salary spreadsheets.

inventory.title: Equipment & Safety Compliance
inventory.tagline: You Export 6 Months of Harness Inspections in 4 Minutes. Building Manager Swoons.
inventory.description: Track personal safety equipment with serial numbers, employee assignments, inspection dates, and automated retirement workflows for failed gear. Daily inspections. Instant exports. Zero panic.

toolbox.title: Safety Briefings & Documentation
toolbox.tagline: The Lawsuit You'll Win Because You Did the Meeting. And You Can Prove It.
toolbox.description: Digital safety forms, PDF rope access plans. Comprehensive safety documentation management. Every meeting logged. Every inspection recorded. Every piece of equipment tracked. The lawyer asks "prove it." You hand them 400 pages. Case dismissed.

payroll.title: Employee Hours & Compensation
payroll.tagline: Dave Worked 87.5 Hours - Including Overtime. Paid $2,887.50. Export. Done.
payroll.description: Select pay period. System aggregates all hours across all projects. Regular hours. Overtime hours. Hourly rates applied. Gross pay calculated. Export to QuickBooks. 30 minutes. Your competitor? Still using Excel for 4 hours. Still making $1,200 mistakes.

quoting.title: One Quote, Every Service
quoting.tagline: Window Cleaning + Dryer Vents + Parkade + In-Suite. One Price.
quoting.description: Create comprehensive quotes combining window cleaning, dryer vents, parkade maintenance, and in-suite work with individual service pricing and photo documentation. Cross-sell without looking desperate. Professional. Complete. Done in 30 minutes.

tracking.title: Real-Time Field Visibility
tracking.tagline: Dave's on Tower One. Has Been Since 7:32am. Working 4h 18m.
tracking.description: Monitor active workers, billable/non-billable hours, and performance analytics with live dashboards. Color-coded status. Green = working. Yellow = break. Red = check on them. Answer clients instantly: "Crew's on-site right now."

safety.title: Safety Compliance
safety.description: Digital safety forms, PDF rope access plans, and comprehensive safety documentation management.

feedback.title: Centralized. Organized. Done.
feedback.description: Mrs. Henderson adds a photo: "Missed my window." She is replied to in 4 minutes: "On it tomorrow, 9am." She stops calling the building manager. They stop calling you. Everyone stops calling. Residents self-serve. You respond same-day. Your competitor? Still using paper.

residents.title: Building Resident Management
residents.tagline: The Contract Renewal Machine. 240 Residents Watch Progress. Submit Feedback. Stop Calling.
residents.description: 240 residents watch progress on their phones. Submit feedback that gets addressed same-day. Tell their council "these guys are professional." Your competitor? Still using paper. Contract renewal rate: 95%. Theirs: 60%. Math is simple.

audit.title: "Show Me Your Inspection Logs"
audit.description: Auditor asks for 6 months of harness inspections. You export PDF in 4 minutes. Every tech. Every day. Every piece of equipment. Building manager swoons.

scheduling.title: Resource Scheduling & Calendar
scheduling.tagline: Sarah Is At Tower One Monday. Tower Three Tuesday. Confirmed.
scheduling.description: Visual calendar showing who's working where, when. Drag-and-drop scheduling. Conflict detection. Weather delay rescheduling. Client-facing calendar links. Answer "when are you coming?" with a link, not a phone call.

clientDashboard.title: Client Visibility Portal
clientDashboard.tagline: "When Will You Be Done?" Link. Click. See.
clientDashboard.description: Give property managers read-only access to their buildings. Progress bars. Photo documentation. Safety compliance scores. Schedule visibility. They stop calling to ask "what's happening?" because they can see it themselves.

safeWorkPractices.title: Safe Work Practices
safeWorkPractices.templatesDescription: Pre-built templates covering essential safety topics for rope access operations
safeWorkPractices.templateNoticeText: These are template Safe Work Practices. Review and customize them to match your specific company policies and operational requirements. Ensure all employees are trained and acknowledge these practices before work commences.

ppe.title: Personal Protective Equipment (PPE)
ppe.description: Guidelines for proper selection, use, and maintenance of personal protective equipment in rope access operations.
principles: PPE is the last line of defense - engineering controls come first
All PPE must be inspected before each use
PPE must be appropriate for the specific hazard
Damaged or expired PPE must be immediately replaced
Workers must be trained in proper PPE use

fallProtection.title: Fall Protection
fallProtection.description: Essential practices for preventing falls from height during rope access operations.
principles: Falls from height are the leading cause of fatalities in construction
Dual rope systems provide redundancy for safety
Anchor points must be independently tested and certified
100% tie-off is required when working at height
Fall arrest equipment must limit free fall to 6 feet or less

manualHandling.title: Manual Handling
manualHandling.description: Safe practices for lifting, carrying, and moving materials during work operations.
principles: Back injuries are often preventable with proper technique
Use mechanical aids whenever possible
Team lifts for loads over 25kg
Plan the lift before attempting
Keep loads close to your body

heatCold.title: Heat and Cold Stress Prevention
heatCold.description: Managing environmental temperature extremes to protect worker health and safety.
principles: Both heat and cold can cause serious medical emergencies
Acclimatization takes time - build up exposure gradually
Hydration is critical in both hot and cold environments
Recognize early warning signs of heat/cold stress
Implement work-rest cycles in extreme conditions

chemical.title: Chemical Safety
chemical.description: Safe handling, storage, and use of cleaning chemicals and hazardous substances.
principles: All chemicals can be hazardous if misused
Safety Data Sheets (SDS) contain critical safety information
Never mix chemicals unless specifically authorized
Use appropriate PPE when handling chemicals
Store chemicals according to compatibility requirements

toolEquipment.title: Tool and Equipment Safety
toolEquipment.description: Safe practices for using hand tools, power tools, and equipment at height.
principles: Tools can become deadly projectiles if dropped from height
All tools must be tethered when working at height
Power tools require additional safety precautions
Inspect tools before each use
Use the right tool for the job

electrical.title: Electrical Safety
electrical.description: Preventing electrical hazards and injuries during rope access work.
principles: Electricity can kill instantly
Maintain safe clearances from power lines
Use GFCI protection for all power tools
Never work on live electrical systems
Report any electrical hazards immediately

emergency.title: Emergency Response
emergency.description: Procedures for responding to emergencies and rescue situations.
principles: Every worker must know emergency procedures
Communication is critical in emergencies
Rescue plans must be in place before work begins
First aid supplies must be readily accessible
Practice emergency drills regularly

flha.title: Field Level Hazard Assessment
flha.icopDescription: All rope access operations must comply with the IRATA International Code of Practice for Industrial Rope Access (TC-102ENG). This document outlines mandatory safety requirements, technical procedures, and best practices for rope access work.

deleteProject.description: Are you sure you want to delete this project? This will permanently remove all associated work sessions, drop logs, and feedback. This action cannot be undone.

harnessInspection.description: Before starting your work session, please confirm if your daily harness inspection has been completed.

startSession.title: Start Work Session?
startSession.description: This will begin tracking your work session for {{buildingName}}. You can log drops throughout the day and end your session when finished.
startSession.descriptionSimple: This will begin tracking your work session for {{buildingName}}. You can end your session later when finished.

uploadPhoto.title: Upload Photo
uploadPhoto.descriptionParkade: Add parking stall number and comment to help residents identify their work.

uploadPhoto.unitHelp: Enter the unit number if this photo is specific to a resident's suite.

results.consolidateMessage: You're already investing in digital tools (${{cost}}/month). OnRopePro consolidates these 6-8 separate systems into ONE platform for ${{onropeCost}}/month, eliminating tool-switching friction and data silos.
results.currentSetupGood: Based on your current setup, you have a solid tech stack. However, OnRopePro could still help by consolidating your tools into one platform built specifically for rope access operations.
results.consolidateBenefits: Consider the benefits of consolidating to a single platform:

email.description: We'll send your personalized ROI report and show you how companies like yours eliminate 32+ hours of admin work monthly.
